title: Job 22:1
text: THEN Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

title: Job 22:2
text: Can a man be profitable unto God, as he that is wise may be profitable unto himself?

title: Job 22:3
text: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous?  or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?

title: Job 22:4
text: Will he reprove thee for fear of thee?  will he enter with thee into judgment?

title: Job 22:5
text: Is not thy wickedness great?  and thine iniquities infinite?

title: Job 22:6
text: For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing.

title: Job 22:7
text: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.

title: Job 22:8
text: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honourable man dwelt in it.

title: Job 22:9
text: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.

title: Job 22:10
text: Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee;

title: Job 22:11
text: Or darkness, that thou canst not see; and abundance of waters cover thee.

title: Job 22:12
text: Is not God in the height of heaven?  and behold the height of the stars, how high they are!

title: Job 22:13
text: And thou sayest, How doth God know?  can he judge through the dark cloud?

title: Job 22:14
text: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.

title: Job 22:15
text: Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden?

title: Job 22:16
text: Which were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflown with a flood:

title: Job 22:17
text: Which said unto God, Depart from us: and what can the Almighty do for them?

title: Job 22:18
text: Yet he filled their houses with good things: but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

title: Job 22:19
text: The righteous see it, and are glad: and the innocent laugh them to scorn.

title: Job 22:20
text: Whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth.

title: Job 22:21
text: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.

title: Job 22:22
text: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.

title: Job 22:23
text: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.

title: Job 22:24
text: Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.

title: Job 22:25
text: Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defence, and thou shalt have plenty of silver.

title: Job 22:26
text: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.

title: Job 22:27
text: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.

title: Job 22:28
text: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee: and the light shall shine upon thy ways.

title: Job 22:29
text: When men are cast down, then thou shalt say, There is lifting up; and he shall save the humble person.

title: Job 22:30
text: He shall deliver the island of the innocent: and it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands.
